result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but DOES qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement



Consecutive to: Any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: $141.72 owed to Walmart Corporation (Case 14CM5168), to be collected by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec.973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.

Submit a DNA sample, if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge and restitution surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance due as a condition of ES. If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons/body armor. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION TO BE DETERMINED BY THE DOC'S, but to include:
- Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens. No positive results.
- No illegal drugs.
- No controlled substances without valid prescription.
- No contact with drug community.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.
- No Contact with Marquise R.
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

The Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  Copies forwarded to OS for processing.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 26, Judge Pocan.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASES 14CM3494, 14CM5168, 15CM64 DISMISSED AND READ IN TO THIS CASE FOR SENTENCING PURPOSES.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms/body armor warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.     Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   Additional statements by:  Marcellius B.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $141.72 owed to Walmart Corporation (Case 14CM5168).
Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Any balance due as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

 The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 120 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with Marquise R.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons/body armor.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but DOES qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year of initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for plea hearing on 3-24-15, 8:30.

Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Menard's stores in Milwaukee County

Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kenneth Jerome Lewis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defense moves to dismiss for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion to dismiss.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
